The British have agreed to surrender claim to the Ambas Bay colony in exchange for a cash sum. The Kamerun colony is now free of territorial disputes, and we are free to expand the economic development of the region.

The British have refused to give up their claims to the Ambas Bay colony. Although this contradicts with our rightful claims in Kamerun, the tiny colony might not be worth a military campaign over, despite our grand imperialist ambitions…

Several missionary and trader expeditions to a region known as Ambas Bay in Cameroon have founded a small colony known as Victoria. By officially annexing the area, we can expand proper British influence in the Gulf of Guinea region.

A great stretch of rural wilderness in northwestern Wyoming has been proposed as the site of a grand “national park”. Known as the Yellowstone Valley, the essentially untouched area is home to volcanic geysers, hot springs, mountain ranges, and a plethora of flora and fauna. Protecting the area would preserve our the natural heritage of our nation.
The National Park in Yellowstone is experiencing a large tourism boom.
The National Park in Hot Springs is experiencing a large tourism boom.

The Hot Springs of Arkansas have become a legendary attraction to many across the country, with travelers far and wide arriving to indulge in the steaming hot and supposedly healing waters of the area. Protecting the area by an Act of Congress will help preserve the area for the future and boost development in the area.

While various wilderness areas have been organized under federal protection to preserve their natural beauty, there exists no single agency to manage these areas. The creation of a National Parks Service will allow us to preserve the natural beauty of America for future generations, and provide a valuable tourism opportunity in rural parts of the nation.

Socialist, Communist, and Anarchist organizing has reached a new wave in America, and elements of law enforcement have proposed in a mass campaign to arrest, try, and deport prominent activists. Although this would be seen as highly undemocratic and an overreach of the federal government’s powers by some, it may be required to protect our republic from would-be Communist revolutionaries.

Slaves whipped. Freedmen whipped. Anyone with a conviction that slavery must be gone from Cuba, whipped until near death. 

Spanish authorities, zealous in their crackdown on potential participants in a slave rebellion, whether it be actually be planned or not, have begun a campaign of terror against the Cuban population. Reports have been received that civilians are being rounded up by Spanish soldiers and then tied to a ladder, where they would be helpless against the oncoming flurry of lashings. 

Non-Cubans have also been implicated in the alleged conspiracy. The former British consul to Cuba, David Turnbull, was convicted of spearheading the conspiracy, despite him having been deported from the island two years earlier.

Following the killing of a drunk and rowdy sailor in a Honolulu jail, a mass of drunken and frenzied whalers and assorted seamen took to riot in Honolulu. Looting and burning much of the harbor, including the local police station, only a lucky wind kept the holds of whale oil themselves from combusting in flame. Citizen militias and local police eventually were able to subdue the rioters, but only after great damages across the city.

'The gale continued in all its fury until two o'clock, when it subsided. It was fearful to see the havoc during its duration. Trees were prostrate in every direction, the mill and engine house, the boiling house, the bowling alley, sugar house, cook house, two of the Chinese and one native house were down. One store house at the beach, and all the native houses there had been blown into the sea...' \nA great hurricane has hit Maui, causing damages across the region and flattening trees and houses alike.

A Catholic missionary from Belgium has begun preaching to the poor and downtrodden of Hawaii, and received considerable admiration from the populace. Known for his intense devotion to assisting the lepers, including preparing food and building infrastructure for leper colonies, his ministry had reached the hearts of many Hawaiians. Alas, he eventually contacted leprosy through his work, and passed away following a struggle with the disease. Becoming something of a local saint, he has become known as a 'Martyr of charity' for his actions.

The great Mauna Loa volcano on the big island of Hawaii has erupted, threatening the nearby town of Hilo. Lieutenant Colonel George S. Patton, a local Air Force officer, has proposed a bombastic plan to stop the lava flow: cluster munitions, launched en masse to divert the flow of the lava to safer channels.

Lieutenant Colonel Patton's plan, against seemingly all possible odds, has worked. Hilo has been saved, as just days after the bombing the flow has apparently reversed direction completely. 7000 pounds of TNT was dropped on the volcano over six days, and the event has become something of a local folklore, with reports of locals attempting to recovering unexploded ordinance as keepsakes.

Inspired by the import of experimental films from Europe and the United States, several cartoonists and artists have founded small animation studios in Tokyo. Adapting newspaper cartoons and legends into simplistic moving pictures, these short films have found some appeal to children and theatregoers in our nascent cinema industry. They have become colloquially known as 'animeshon', a loan of an English word describing the technique of moving cartoons.

Amidst a boom of novels marketed towards women and girls, a curious subgenre known as 'Class-S' has emerged that has received outraged from conservative sectors. Usually involving romantic friendships between female students, the works tend to revolve around themes of forbidden love, melodramatic romance, and frequently suicide. Although the works have proven popular with teenage audiences, demands to curtail or ban the works have mounted, with many claiming the works portrayal of lesbian romances crosses into the obscene.

A simple children's book published in London has received international popularity. Starring a boy named Christopher Robbin and his animal friends (including the eponymous Winnie-the-Pooh, a bear), the book relays many short stories of adventures in the Hundred Acre Woods.

A cartoon has reached quite a viewership, starring the exploits of the rough and spinach-loving Popeye and his beloved sweetheart, Olive Oyl. Quickly becoming a symbol in popular culture, the 'Popeye' character has been featured in many newspapers, advertisements, and songs alike.

A new sugary beverage has swept across the nation in recent years. Invented by a Confederate veteran by the name of John Pemberton and bottled in Vicksburg, Coca-Cola, named for its primary ingredients (cocaine and kola nut), has captured the taste-buds of much of our country, and has become something of a luxury good overseas, where carbonated beverage production has proven less common.

A highly unique medical research institute has been founded in Berlin by Magnus Hirschfeld. Dubbed the Institut für Sexualwissenschaft ('Institute of Sexology'), the Institute has become a self-described safe haven for homosexuals and transsexuals in Germany. The Institute has become an outspoken advocate for the rights of homosexuals, supporting a radical social programme including advocating for the public acceptance of homosexuality, medical care for the sex reassignment of transsexual patients, and the existence of a 'third gender' outside of male and female. Frequently subject to vandalism by right wing elements, the Institute has become a flashpoint in the evolving social environment of this new Berlin.

A far right student organization associated with the NSDAP has attacked and demolished the controversial Institute of Sexology, known for their steadfast defense of the rights of homosexuals and transsexuals. A book burning of the Institute's library has taken place in the Opernplatz, and many of the Institute's faculty and patients have been taken to prisons and labor camps, or disappeared entirely. As the smoke rises over Berlin, one cannot help but feel another flame has been snuffed out.

An illustrator named Gerda Wegener has become something of a celebrity within art circles in Denmark. Known for her colorful Art Nouveau paintings, usually depicting tender scenes between women, Wegener has adopted an extravagant bohemian lifestyle alongside her husband.

The famed portrait artist Gerda Wegener has revealed that her longtime female model has been her own supposed husband, Mr. Wegener. Wegener has put forward a petition with our government requesting a change of name to Lili Ilse Elvenes, and a change of sex to female. While transvestites are nothing new to Copenhagen, changing the legal sex of a citizen has never been performed in any European state, or perhaps any state whatsoever. \nLili and her wife have great cultural influence within the art world, and the issue has become a sensation in German and Danish newspapers. We could allow the change, but this would spark great unrest due to the technical allowance of a homosexual marriage. Alternatively, we could annul the marriage through an act of the government, and allow the marriage to go through following this.

An Okinawan activist and businessman named Kyuzo Toyama has organized large scale immigration from Okinawa to our islands. With the islands experiencing economic woes and recession, many immigrants have come with Kyuzo to work in the plantation industry. However, this migration has not been well-received by the rest of the local Japanese community, who have degraded and insulted many an Okinawan migrant, viewing them as backwards and clueless.

A group of Japanese immigrants have come to our kingdom, seeking employment in the sugarcane plantations. Known as the 'Gannenmono', the 'first-year-people', they have become the foundation of the Japanese community in our islands, and bring with them their cuisine and culture to the fabric of Hawai'i

Three of our young princes, on their educational journey abroad, have introduced our traditional sport of surf-riding to the United States. Traditionally only enjoyed by Polynesians, the practice of lying or standing upright on boards amidst the ocean waves has appealed to some British and American tourists. They have come to a stretch on O'ahu known as Waikiki to enjoy the ancient past-time alongside native Hawaiian surfers. Some have even returned to start surfing clubs along the coast of California.

Japanese immigrants to our islands have brought a new dish, known as Shave Ice. Inspired by the traditional desert of Kakigori, shave ice has become a favorite among plantation workers of all nationalities. Made simply by shaving a block of ice into fine shards and then flavoring it with sweet syrups, the desert has become a Hawaiian culinary symbol for those hot humid days.

Inspired by the Vaquero traditions of Mexico, a unique culture of cattle farming has arisen on the Big Island of Hawaii. Calling themselves Paniolo, these horseback riders having taken to many cowboy and vaquero traditions from the Americas, and even spread the Mexican-American sporting event of Rodeo to the island.

Following the untimely death of King Lunalilo, a contentious royal election has begun. The three primary candidates are Prince David Kalakaua, Queen Consort Emma Kaleleokalani, and Lady Bernice Pauahi Bishop, all once classmates at the Royal School. Prince Kalakaua is a nativist and intensely supports the economic and political sovereignty of Hawaii
French: Queen Emma is outspokenly Pro-British, and Bernice Bishop prefers a strong relationship with the Americans. Out of all the candidates, Emma and Kalakaua enjoy the most support, and conflicts are high going into the royal election.

English: Following the election of King Kalakaua to the throne of Hawaii, the Emmaites (supports of Queen Emma’s candidacy) have rioted during the official counting of votes for the Royal Election. Attacking Kalakaua’s supporters and vandalizing the Honolulu Courthouse, the riot was only put down by the combined forces of British and American marines, alongside local Hawaiian police and militia. Thirteen legislators were severely injuried, with one, Representative Lonoaea, dying from his injuries. Although Emma herself condemned the violence, the Emmaites stay militant and continue demanding her installation.

Her majesty Queen Kaleleokalani, better known as “Queen Emma”, has passed away. A strong supporter of British economic investment in Hawaii, in her death the British have proposed the creation of an official protectorate encompassing the Hawaiian Islands. While King Kalakaua assumes the throne, it is unclear in what capacity he shall govern.

The death of the pro-British Queen Emma Kaleleokalani has created a power vacuum in the island kingdom of Hawaii. Several of our foreign ministers have proposed the use of this opportunity to create a British protectorate over the islands, but this may incur some minor grumbling from the other powers with interests in the Pacific region.

Our Queen Pauhai has passed away today in Honolulu. Beloved by the common people for her philanthropy and the capitalists for her pro-American stance, her death and the resulting of succession of King Kalakaua has put our kingdom into an awkward position. It is very likely that the Americans will expand their political influence in the islands to prevent losing their economic expansion cultivated under the late Queen. These may be dark days for Hawaii…
After the USA's pacification of our territory, our Monarchy has been restored and the Red, white and blue flies again over the 'Iolani Palace.

With our freedom secured, Queen Lili'uokalani has proposed a new constitution for our Kingdom rolling back the Bayonet Constitution and restoring the rights of the 1864 Constitution. Granting women's suffrage, minority rights, greater executive power to the Monarchy, and curtailing the authority of the Big Five, the constitution will be seen as a restoration of Hawaiian sovereignty.

With our economic destitution following the war of independence against Spain, instability and civil wars, the lack of foreign investment and the inability to acquire loans, we were long unable to search for rumored deposits of valuable veins of iron and coal. Now that we've gained significant standing on the international stage and have sufficient capital to invest in prospecting, perhaps it is time to begin the exploration and exploitation of our underdeveloped resources.

A earthquake struck the Croatian city of Zagreb today at 7:33 AM. The tremor and its small aftershocks have wrought destruction on many local buildings. Most tragically, the Zagreb Cathedral was severely damaged, with its nave suffering collapse and the tower destroyed beyond repair. The human toll, on the other hand, is miraculously small--only one person has been confirmed dead.

President Nicolás de Perola's betrayal of his promise to implement a federal system in Peru has sparked a rebellion in Loreto. The general Ricardo Seminario y Aramburú, amassing a militia for the cause, has declared the Federal State of Loreto as an integral part of Peru. Locals are showing strong support for this effort due to the government's neglect of the Department, despite its economic importance due to the rubber boom.

500-800 Cretan Christians of the city of Candia have been massacred by our forces. This outbreak of violence was motivated by Western powers' recent condemnation concerning our treatment of Christians on Crete. Muslim irregulars burnt part of the city and, over the course of four hours, slaughtered Christian civilians by the hundreds. \n\nThe massacre will certainly cause a swift, decisive and united international response, incurring upon us the wrath of the Western powers.

The so-called "Pig War" against the British has ended, in our favor. We could take this opportunity to claim the whole of Vancouver Island and the Queen Charlotte Islands, both known for their wealth in timber and minerals.

The so-called 'Pig War' against the Americans has ended, in our favor. We should take this opportunity to expand our control to the whole of the Puget Sound region, valuable for fishing and agricultural development.

Starvation and hypothermia are wracking the residents and livestock of North America in this particularly lethal winter. When snow came earlier than expected and fell in unprecented amounts, cow pastures were destroyed and cattle ended up starving to death. Human inhabitants, meanwhile, are reported to have been frequently dying to hypothermia and frostbite. The weather has spread across the entire continent--even leading to snowfall in San Francisco. All we can ask: when will it end?

A severe earthquake hit Guatemala today at around 9:30 PM. With its epicenter around the village of Patzicía, the tremor damaged communities in Amatitlán, Escuintla, Chimaltenango and Antigua Guatemala. \n\nIt also completely destroyed the village of Parramos, whose inhabitants had no choice but to relocate their homesteads 3-and-a-half kilometers south of the original settlement. Armed bandits also contributed to the villagers' flight by robbing them of the few remaining possessions they had after their homes' destruction. Fortunately, authorities later arrested and summarily executed the bandits.

An earthquake has struck the province of Esmeraldas. The tremor's magnitude has caused serious damage to local communities as well as generating tsunamis reaching Colombia, Costa Rica, Mexico, Hawaii, and even Japan.

An earthquake rocked Ecuador and southern Colombia yesterday, causing severe damage. The seismic center formed near El Ángel, Carchi province, and aftershocks persisted for 24 hours. Seismic activity was reported again today near Ibarra, Imbabura province. \n\nEl Ángel was described as "ruined" by the destruction. Ibarra and Otavalo, in Imbabura, were utterly destroyed, with 6,000 casualties total reported between them.

The northeastern Andes have been rocked by a large tremor that traversed from Cúcuta all the way to both Bogotá in the west and Caracas to the east. Property damage and fatalities are still being assessed, and deaths have been estimated to be over 1,000. 900 have been reported dead in Cúcuta alone.

An earthquake has been reported today in Benkoelen and Padang, Sumatra, the magnitude of which has been so severe as to generate tsunamis touchdowning in several directions. Tsunamis resulting from the earthquake were reported in Ceylon, the Maldives, and even the Seychelles--all of which have also racked up notable damage to property and human lives.

The Caribbean island of Guadaloupe experienced a rare, extremely devastating earthquake today, wreaking havoc and leaving thousands of casualties in its wake. The town of Pointe-à-Pitre reports the destruction of 8-900 of the 1,222 houses in the area that existed before the earthquake struck. Estimates of deaths range in the thousands, with some tens reported in nearby islands also affected, including Antigua and Montserrat. Aftershocks, meanwhile, travelled up the Atlantic and could even be felt in New York City.

An earthquake wreaked havoc on southwestern Bulgaria today, with an epicenter in the village of Kresna. Damage to the houses within Kresna was manageable, due to their sturdy wooden frames. However, the villages of Dzhumaya, Bansko, and Razlog were affected by severe damage, and Simitli and Krupnik were totally destroyed. More than 200 people perished in the first two shocks.

A powerful tremor occurred today along the Chilean-Argentine border, within the village of Vallenar. A line of extensive damage extending from Copiapó to Coquimbo was reported, with around 1,000 confirmed dead. Meanwhile, resulting tsunamis have killed several hundreds in Coquimbo.

Hispaniola has suffered a huge earthquake with an epicenter around the city of Cap-Haitien. The quake struck at around 5:00 PM and was felt across the entire country and other islands in the Caribbean, such as Jamaica and Puerto Rico. It has tragically devastated the North Cape region of Haiti, resulting in around 5,000 casualties when counting fatalities from resulting tsunamis. The tsunamis after the shocks particularly devastated Port-de-Paix, where 200-300 died, and completely destroyed Môle-Saint-Nicolas--leaving almost no one in the town alive.

An earthquake with an epicenter in Jericho has left devastation across Palestine. Though the quake lasted around 5 seconds, damage was immediately felt as far away as Jerusalem, as well as in Nablus, Lydda, Ramle, and Tiberias. 300 buildings in Nablus suffered destruction, and both the city's Victory Mosque and Great Mosque were damaged. In Jerusalem--most tragically--the earthquakes caused the domes of al-Aqsa Mosque and the Church of the Holy Sepulchre to collapse. Damage was also wrought on the Old City's Jewish quarter. In Transjordan, damages were reported in the city of al-Salt. The earthquake left an estimated 287 dead.

New Zealand experienced an incredibly powerful earthquake today, perhaps the most powerful since the start of European contact. The epicenter was located within the Wairarapa, a province in the south of North Island. Damage to settlements in the epicenter's vicinity was miraculously avoided due to structures being rebuilt to withstand future earthquakes. However, the jetties of Wellington Harbor were rendered unusable due to the quake uplifting much of its land. Severe landslides were also reported. Despite all this, less than 10 fatalities have been confirmed.

An earthquake rattled the Slovene city of Ljubljana today, destroying thousands of homes in its wake. Its epicenter was identified in Jance, a town east of Ljubljana's center. More than 100 aftershocks were felt in an area of 385,000 square kilometers--reaching as far as Florence, Vienna, Assisi, and Spalato. Casualties, however, remain few.

An earthquake has devastated the West Indies today as two shocks were felt from the island of Saint Thomas. Two days after the touchdown of the deadly San Narciso Hurricane in the region, shaking was felt across the town of Frederiksted and to a lesser extent throughout other islands in the Greater Antilles. Casualties have been reported within the 50s range, including from resulting tsunamis. One such wave, reported to have been like a "straight white wall, 15 to 23 feet," left the British mail vessal La Plata swept away and its passengers and crew all killed.

Citizens of Tokyo and its surrounding cities are in shock. At 11:58 AM, a powerful earthquake erupted and raged on for several minutes, destroying property and life as the tremor was felt in Tokyo, Yokohama, Chiba, Shizuoka, and Kanagawa. Entire neighborhoods are left in rubble, with many houses also engulfed by stove fires started while residents were cooking lunch before the quake. According to the captain of the SS Dongola, which docked in Yokohama before disaster struck, within minutes whole buildings evaporated into clouds of dust. The authorities could not contain the ensuing fires due to water mains bursting from damage. An estimated 120,000+ have died. The suffering of the Japanese people in this catastrophe has also led, horrifyingly, to racial scapegoating. As residents emerged from their ruins, ethnic Koreans were framed for anarchy and crime in the quake's aftermath. With police giving explicit support, lynch mobs have descended on Korean laborers and Japanese left-wing activists to vent misguided frustrations, leading to thousands of reported murders.
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Ukraine!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Belarus!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Lithuania!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Latvia!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Ireland!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Occitania!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Georgia!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Azerbaijan!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Australia!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform Austria!
Now that we have united our region, the time has come to reform France!

News has reached us that liberal leader Ramón Saturnino Andrés Freire y Serrano landed in Chiloé Island at the head of a military expedition consisting of two ships. While the sailors are Chilean, the ships and weapons were supplied to him in Lima by the Peru-Bolivian Confederation, plotting to have Freire overthrow our government. However, the crew of one of the ships turned against him shortly after having captured the island and handed him over to our government. Freire had lead the Liberals in the Civil War of 1830-31 and was subsequently exiled, but evidently this hasn't prevented him from causing more instability. How shall we deal with him this time?

An earthquake has struck the city of Copiapó, with shocks reaching from Atacama and Coquimbo to Santiago de Chile. The most notable damages were across this entire stretch of land, with local newspapers publishing stories about the destruction of homes, churches, and bridge archways. Thankfully, the damage came to pass, and no tsunamis were reported afterward.
May we recover fully from this tremor.

Yet anopther earthquake has struck the city of Copiapó, leading to notable damages within the city and its outlying areas. Although no casualties have been reported, the shocks have left around 115 homes destroyed and another 224 declared uninhabitable. Reports also surfaced of damage to the Copiapó-Caldera railway. Copiapó as of now remains shrouded in a veil of dust that leaves the city in total darkness, a reminder of the disaster even as its wrath has come to pass. The earthquake's shocks were perceived from Atacama and Coquimbo down to Santiago de Chile.

Punta Arenas, a settlement in the far southern tip of Chile, suffered an destructive earthquake today. Due to the town having been founded only 48 years prior, builders did not reinforce its most recent structures to withstand such a shock. As a result, 94% of all buildings in the town suffered major damage, while 64% collapsed entirely. 16 people are reported dead, and 26 are reported missing. 659 were injured, and 4,576 have lost their homes.

Copiapó yet again fell victim to the terror of another earthquake. With a VII rating on the Mercalli scale--a "very strong" category--buildings have again collapsed into rubble due to poor retrofitting. Yet, as is fitting for the precedent set by the two previous minimally fatal earthquakes, only eight people have been confirmed dead.
That town is cursed. No one should live there.

An earthquake has wrought destruction upon the Maule region of Chile, leading to fatalities and building collapses from Talca to Concepción. Rated XI on the Mercalli Scale, the tremor lasted approximately a minute and 45 seconds. 108 residents of Talca have been confirmed dead, as well as 67 in Constitución, and another 67 in other surrounding villagers. The quake also caused the Barahona Dam, on the Cachapoal River, to collapse, crushing 57 minors to their deaths. 279 people in total have been killed, while another 1,083 were wounded. Over 120,000 are now left homeless.

The town of Shamakhi, in Azerbaijan, has fallen victim to an earthquake. The area has historically been a zone of high seismic activity, though this particular earthquake has wrought catastrophic damage to the town that newspapers have compared to Judgment Day. An estimated 2,000 residents were killed. Thousands were injured. Up to 20,000 were rendered homeless. Houses, markets, mosques, madrasahs, bathhouses--all wiped off the map.

A seism has rocked the Balkans after shocks erupted from Vrancea County, Moldavia. The earthquake occured at 8:00 PM and was felt most in Bucharest, though shocks permeated all the way to Sevastopol and even Constantinople itself. Notable in addition to 74 confirmed deaths is the destruction of hundreds of churches within Wallachia and Moldavia. Powerful landslides also occurred in Moldavia, one of which even closed Ghilcos Brook, a tributary of the Bicaz River--sealing the water for good.
The earth shakes and we pierce the heavens with our cries of terror!

The residents of central Bulgaria watched helplessly over the past four days as two tremors annihilated their homes and properties. With one quake centered in Chirpan and another in Plovdiv, the latter occurring four days later, 70,000 buildings total suffered collapse and an estimated 127 people have died. The quakes also were felt in nearby Greece and caused significant damage there.

Unrest against Siam's absolute monarchy has culminated in the launching of an official revolution. King Rama VI has done little to resolve his nation's increasing debt and instead has fostered corruption, leading to his court and military to turn against him. These military officers and soldiers formed the Khana Ratsadon, or "People's Party," to force the king to relinquish absolute power. They demand a constitutional monarchy and a national assembly, creating a European-style government. Is it time for the old order to die out?
With our own soldiers at our throats, perhaps it is.

'Shame upon the guilty wretches that dare propose, and all that countenance such a proposition. We live here -- have lived here -- have a right to live here, and mean to live here.'\n\nWhile President Lincoln has long been a supporter of the American Colonization Society and its efforts to resettle freed blacks in Liberia, his position has become increasingly unacceptable as black people and abolitionists see it as a method of depriving African-Americans of their freedom and perpetuating slavery. Now, Frederick Douglass, a famous escaped slave, abolitionist, social reformer, orator, writer and statesman has approached Lincoln and conferred with him on the matter of settling free blacks overseas -- a proposition that Douglass could not more vehemently oppose. Whether his arguments convinced Lincoln will remain to be seen.

The possibility of founding a black colony in the Chiriquí district of Panama, an outlying part of Colombia, has been proposed in Congress. The area has evidence of very rich coal mines and among the finest harbors in the world. There are, however, several issues: Colombia is a very unstable country that has seen many civil wars. Additionally, the region is disputed with Costa Rica. Both may object to us purchasing the land.

The United States of America have proposed purchasing the Chiriquí District of Colombia as a colony to settle free blacks in. However, giving them this land would be seen as selling out to the Americans. Though we could very well use the money -- 100k to be exact -- the damage to our international standing and the support of our government by the people may be greater.

Colombia's government has accepted the offer of purchasing Chiriquí, due to their national debt and dire need of funds. The dream of a colony in Panama has become a reality, and already free blacks have signed up to emigrate.
Colombia's government has turned down the offer of purchasing Chiriquí, citing their national integrity being at stake. The dream of a colony in Panama has evaporated as quickly as it materialized.

El Comercio, a Lima newspaper, published the text of the Royal Certificate of 1802. This document, the existence of which was long doubted, restored Maynas to the Viceroyalty of the Peru. With the public in a bellicose mood and justification falling into our hands, now is the time to re-assert our claims in Ecuador. Already, a pamphlet has appeared in Quito entitled 'An Ecuadorian's reply to El Comercio', increasing tensions between our countries.

Countries across Europe have begun establishing so-called 'gendarmeries', armed forces somewhere between police and army. They are trained for combat and more heavily armed than regular policemen, but never face enemy armies. Organizing such a force would help maintain order in our empire -- especially in the unruly Balkans.
The Asakir-i Zaptiye Nizamnamesi is our answer to unrest. A force of trained gendarmes, they ensure order in the empire.

Local farmers in $PROVINCENAME$ are experiencing a boom in profits from their sugar crops. Though the province's agriculture isn't yet fully specialized in sugar, it may be time to change that. Sugar is indeed a wildly profitable cash crop, after all.

The Costa Rican colonel Héctor Zúñiga's army crossed into the Panamanian town of Pueblo Nuevo de Coto, occupying it. The colonel did so as a power play to claim the disputed border territories between us and Costa Rica. Since colonial times, the exact border between Costa Rica and Panama was never clearly defined due to the annexation of disputed lands by Gran Colombia, which Panama was part of. Zúñiga's action is clearly an act of war. The Costa Ricans must be repelled!

News has reached us that Colonel Héctor Zúñiga has decided to cross into the Panamanian town of Pueblo Nuevo de Coto, occupying it. The colonel did so as a power play to claim the disputed border territories between us and Panama. Since colonial times, the exact border between Costa Rica and Panama was never clearly defined due to the annexation of disputed lands by Gran Colombia, which Panama was part of. Zúñiga's action has been seen as an act of war by the now mobilizing Panamanians.

A war has broken out between Costa Rica and Panama over the disputed territories on the Coto river running through the two countries. With our interest in dominating trade across the Panama Canal, it might be beneficial to intervene. The victor might end up changing the balance of power in Central America and either harm or benefit our business there. How shall we proceed?

The United States has sent a battleship to back Costa Rica's side in our war over Coto. Maintaining order in the region is in their economic interest. They threaten full intervention if we refuse to surrender, which would pit us against the full might of the United States.
The United States has sent a battleship to support our side in the war over Coto. Panama is unwilling to risk facing them, and as such thanks to the Americans they have surrendered.
Costa Rica is unwilling to risk facing us in a war with Panama. They have aborted their war.

The United States has sent a battleship to support our side in the war over Coto. However, Panama is willing to risk facing them, and as such the Americans have begun a full-scale intervention on our behalf.
Panama is willing to face us in a war with Costa Rica. Is such a tiny country capable of mounting an defense against our much larger nation?

The United States has sent a battleship to support our side in the war over Coto. However, Costa Rica is willing to risk facing them, and as such the Americans have begun a full-scale intervention on our behalf.
Costa Rica is willing to face us in a war with Panama. Is such a tiny country capable of mounting an defense against our much larger nation?

$COUNTRY_ADJ$ Fiji has just been declared a colony in the capital city of Suva. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government commissioned charters and maps to assess the economic potential of the colony and in $CAPITAL$ several companies expressed their interest in opening new plantations as territories are charted. Now with the charters almost complete and with the new colonial organization in place, the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ companies interested in developing new business are drawing plans to expand their business.\nFiji has a lush tropical climate, allowing many cash crops to flourish. It is up to us to decide which would bring the most profit, or we could avoid potentially angering the Fijian natives by leaving them to their fisheries.

A exceptionally pure species of sapphire became known to Indian authorities today as one such gem was brought to Simla. The gem--deep blue hue and a sunny glazed luster to match--allegedly was sold to the trader by a huntsman in the Zaskar Mountain Range, who used it to light his pipe instead of his usual quartz stone he'd find on the ground. A notable British jeweller bought the gem for dirt cheap, and soon enough word spread to the Maharajah of Kashmir, who ordered his soldiers to find the sapphire mines and occupy them. Kashmir very well may be home to some of the finest sapphires in the world.

The Maharajah of Kashmir, noting the drop in revenue from the Kashmir sapphire industry, has sent geologist T.D. LaTouche to survey the Zaskar Mountains' sapphire mines for their viability. LaTouche concluded that most of the mines were exhausted of their sapphire veins, except for the valley floor. Mining continues there, but the sales from their gems will never be as profitable as before.

Founded as a colony by the Phoenecians to be a commercial outpost, the port of Algiers is today the most important North African seaport providing trade between the rest of Algeria and the Mediterranean. In the 14th century, the port was conquered by the Spanish who were later expelled in 1529, and was instead brought under the control of the Ottomans. During the next 300 years the port would be a major port for the Barbary pirates. If we decide to take the port, we could use it as a staging ground for further expeditions into Africa.

Oran was founded at the beginning of the 10th century by Andalusian merchants as a base for trade with the North African hinterland. Like the port of Algiers, it eventually ended up with the Spanish, who later would lose it to the Ottoman Turks. In 1732 Spain would retake the port, only for it to be abandoned and returned to the Turks following a devastating earthquake in 1790, who would settle a Jewish community in the port-city. Oran is strategically valuable as both the second-largest city of Algeria and the key to the Algerian West.

A multi-effect evaporator is an apparatus consisting of multiple evaporator bodies linked together in such a way as to allow steam produced by boiling the water in one evaporator to boil water in successive evaporators, with only the first evaporator in the sequence requiring an external heating source. The multi-effect evaporator was invented and patented by Louisiana Creole inventor Norbert Rillieux to increase the efficiency of refining sugar from cane juice. In the early 19th century, the primary method of refining cane sugar from juice was the "sugar train" or "Jamaica train," a typically slave-operated process which relied on pouring hot cane juice reduction through a succession of bowls to increase its evaporation rate. Rillieux's multi-effect evaporator displayed vast improvements in safety, efficiency, and cost over contemporary methods, and to this day remains a staple in industrial-scale evaporation for refining products ranging from cane and beet sugar to sea salt and wood pulp.

A sugarcane harvester is a large piece of agricultural machinery used to harvest and partially process sugarcane. It remains similar in function and design to the combine harvester. Essentially a storage vessel on a truck with a mechanical extension, the machine cuts the stalks at the base, strips the leaves off, and then cuts the cane into segments. These are then deposited into either the on-board container, or a separate vehicle traveling alongside.

A skidder is any type of heavy vehicle used in a logging operation for pulling cut trees out of a forest in a process called "skidding", in which the logs are transported from the cutting site to a landing. With logging operations moving further into forests and further away from sawmills, the process of skidding has become more cumbersome. However, where forest railways are installed, new rail-based skidders have been introduced that can skid logs to the railroad for loading. They are often high-performance and can skid logs from up to four directions at a time.

Euphoria has given way to depression. The streets of Santa Cruz swell with people who have lost their jobs after the price fall of the Canary Islands’ highest-demanded good. \nThe price of Canarian cochineals, a parasite from which carmine dye is extracted, has fallen after cheaper cochineals from Central America began to flood the market. The Canarian economy will now be relegated again to sugar and tobacco.

At the age of 67, Emperor Franz I of the Austrian Empire died, whereupon his mentally and physically impaired son Ferdinand I ascended the throne. Because of Ferdinand's inabilities, a so-called Geheime Regierungskonferenz (Secret Government Conference), which includes Klemens Wenzel, Fürst Metternich, assumed day-to-day control of the government for him.

With the defeat of the Dungan Rebellion, several thousand Hui Muslims have fled west, towards the lands of the Kyrgyz and Kazakhs under the influence of the Russian Empire. Leaving their old lives behind, the Dungan imams seek a new home for their people and their faith.

Constructed in 1902-1903, SS Eastland was a passenger ship of 1,961 tonnes. The ship has had previous incidents of listing, but never in the magnitude of this recent event. On the 24th of July, 1915, Eastland would set out on a voyage following the retrofitting of additional and newer lifeboats in accordance with the new Seamen’s Act, which was a consequential measure of the Titanic disaster. This additional weight may have made the Eastland more top-heavy. At 7:10AM on the 24th of July, the ship had been filled to her passenger capacity, and started to list to the port side. By 7:28AM the Eastland was listing so heavily that she rolled over completely on her port side, coming to rest on the bottom of the river. Barely half the ship was now underwater, and with most of the passengers already below deck due to the cold and damp weather, the results were that many people got trapped underneath the ship and waterline. A total of 844 passengers, of which 220 were Czech immigrants, as well as 4 crew members have been killed in the accident.

Ever since we and the Argentine states gained independence from the Spanish, diplomatic relations have been steadily getting more heated over the disputed borders of overlapping territories in Patagonia. We have a valid claim to all of Patagonia, which traces back to the 16th century during which Pedro de Valdivia obtained rights from the Spanish crown to establish a captaincy reaching to the southern tip of Patagonia, at the Strait of Magellan. Valdivia subsequently founded multiple cities throughout southern Chile, intending to reach the Strait of Magellan. If we alleviate concerns with the US regarding shipping rights through the strait, we could secure their neutrality on the matter, which would mean we may press our claim without fear of intervention.

A Russian spy by the name of Behrens-Pawlowski has been murdered by agents of the Polish People's Association, a militant group advocating for the restoration of Poland, in defiance of the three great powers jointly controlling our country -- Russia, Prussia and Austria. Since the establishment of the Free City of Krakow in 1815, thousands of Poles from the surrounding absolute monarchies have migrated to the free city to escape the foreign persecution and live in a Polish state. In particular, many agitants for independence of Poles from Russia, Prussia and Austria have come to Krakow to escape arrest and plot eventual rebellions. Now, in retaliation for the murder, the three great powers have demanded we expel the migrants -- and allow foreign troops to enter our territory to enforce the policy. Refusal to cooperate will likely result in a joint Russian-Prussian-Austrian invasion.

Since the establishment of the Free City of Krakow in 1815, thousands of Poles from Russia, Prussia and Austria have migrated to the free city -- mainly agitants for Polish independence escaping arrest and plotting rebellions. However, the Krakowian government under Kasper Wieloglowski has refused to cooperate. Perhaps the time has come to end Krakow's freedom?

A man named Ahmed Mokrani has presented himself to our authorities in Constantine. He was recently ousted from power in the Kingdom of Beni Abbas by a treacherous distant cousin of his, Abdesselem Mokrani. Ahmed has proposed a deal: If we support him so he can retake his throne, he will be our ally and vassal. This would secure the mountains of Beni Abbas far more efficiently than a costly occupation. The tribesmen would be much more obedient under the rule of a Mokrani ruler in league with us than under a colonial administration.

With the chaos in Guatemala having lead to the government of the state being deposed and the formation of a new state, Los Altos, our weakness and instability has been revealed all too clearly to the people. Especially conservatives, still furious about José Gregorio Salazar y Castro being ousted from power by the legislative assembly despite being democratically elected, have supported Nicaragua's secession from our federation. We must ask ourselves: Is it even viable to try quelling this revolt? Perhaps the time has come to admit that our union is doomed to fail.

Baron Manfred von Richthofen, or the Red Baron- referring to the red painted Albatros D.III and the current Fokker Dr.I triplane he flies, has recently earned a fierce reputation as a top fighter ace. Richthofen is the commander of Jasta 11, also called the “Flying Circus”, yet he did not start as a soldier of the skies. Richthofen started his career as a cavalry reconnaissance officer, but due to the advent of trench warfare, his regiment was dismounted. Eventually, he joined Die Fliegertruppen des deutschen Kaiserreiches as an observer on reconnaissance missions, and was later transferred to another flying unit where he was taught to fly solo. He has scored almost 80 kills so far, more than any other pilot to date, making him a feared adversary for our foes, as well as a legendary hero to the German people.

After the Ottoman conquest of Algeria, the perfidious and faithless Algerians to the West launched multiple expeditions to our lands in the East illegally, such as Biskra or Constantine, subsequently losing that precious lands to the Ottomans and relegating ourselves to a rump, meek state. Now, with our prestige regained and Algeria in chaos, we can lay claim to our rightful lands.

Our great empire has expanded beyond the Atlas, conquering the lands of the Sahara and the fertile plains of the Mediterranean that once belonged to the Beylik of Algeria. After taking Laghwat and eliminating all opposition, we can now become our own Algeria.

Klemens von Metternich, the conductor of the Concert of Europe, is the mastermind behind Austrian diplomacy. In the Congress of Vienna of 1815, he shaped the Europe to what it is today. A staunch proponent of absolutism, he works toward the suppressing of liberalism and the maintaining of the ancien regime, making him unpopular among the people.

Prime Minister Klemens von Metternich's iron fist finally has pushed Viennese liberals to the breaking point. As students and working class subjects in the city continuously have issued petitions for government reform and taken to the streets, the government has responded with troops to suppress them. But all the unrest came to a head today, when a group of Viennese students called for Metternich's resignation under the threat of more rioting. The students have even suggested a deal: They will form a temporary 'Academic Legion' to help suppress the Hungarian Revolt under the condition that Metternich resigns. \n\n§RWarning: You have to merge the brigades that are generated by this event§W

The Concert of Europe's mastermind, Klemens von Metternich, has died today. Metternich singlehandedly negotiated a détante with Napoleonic France during its rise to dominance over Europe, alowing Austria to buy time and join the allies in the War of the Sixth Coalition. After Napoleon's overthrow, he served as a chancellor of Austria, known for suppressing nationalist revolts and consolidating Austria's rule over Central Europe by resisting Ottoman and Russian expansion. Though his chancellorship floundered during the Revolutions of 1848, he remained vital to the empire and Emperor Franz Joseph. Though his absolutist views were massively unpopular among liberals, Metternich will be missed. His death strikes a huge blow to conservatism in Austria.

To secure Denmark's role as a trade power in Europe, Copenhagen ought to be made a free trade port. We suggest setting aside a portion of the city for duty-free trade with foreign merchant vessels. This would help us stay economically relevant in the area, in light of the construction of the Kiel Canal and the resulting drawing of trade to Germany.

The Holy See, under Pope Pius IX, has published a new document of errors, or heresies, condemned by the Catholic Church. This "Syllabus of Errors" proclaims a total of eighty heresies, further expanding on the Church's positions on various topics. Those topics, however, extend far more into the political than what the Church has authority on. For example, it states it is heretical to state that Protestantism, or any other religion besides Catholicism, can provide salvation. It also issues a blanket condemnation of socialism, communism, Bible societies, Christian liberalism, and secularism. In Protestants' eyes, this has come as a shock and has been severely panned by them--since they assert no one group has whole authority over God's message. Catholics are also heavily divided, with many seeing it as an attack on personal values outside the Church's authority.
How much power should one Pope have?

Recent momentous conflicts prove that war is changing. Gone are the days of gentlemen spending glorified twenty-someodd years in the army, buying their way into the officer rank while exhibiting huge gaps in military knowledge. War Secretary Edward Cardwell proposes completely overhauling the enlistment, promotion, organization, and equipment of the British Army to compete with Prussia's highly professional soldiers. We should follow suit.

Further reforms to the British Army's organization may be necessary. War Secretary Hugh Childers proposes reorganizing our regiments into two line battalions and two militia battalions as the standard for our military. The line infantry will ensure a strong front in battle, while the militia battalions will provide reserves in the back of the formation. We should also reorganize rifle volunteer corps into battalions we can call on at a moment's notice.

The British Army lacks a robust expeditionary force, able to be ready for combat at the outbreak of war. War Secretary Richard Haldane wishes to overhaul the British expeditionary units, making them fully organized during peacetime and having reserves to boot. We will reorganize the Volunteer Force and the Yeomanry to fulfill such a role.
Our military is working hard to implement large-scale reforms. We cannot propose any new ones until we have fully implemented these current ones.

In Chougacha, a small village in Bengal, tensions are at a boiling point. The local workers in the indigo factories are refusing to work and are taking up arms against the planters and factory owners. There are disturbing reports of planters being tried by these peasants, and subsequently executed. Even still, if not more disturbingly, the Indian middle class is in support of these rebellious peasants, writing newspapers and plays about the plight of the indigo workers. Already, the planters are hiring mercenaries, threatening to make the revolt even larger. We must do something to stop this.

Perugia is in an uproar over the Holy See's decision to continue exercising sovereignty over central Italy, despite Italian unification seeming all the more inevitable. Masses of Perugian residents took up arms and confronted Swiss Guards dispatched by the Vatican. The rebellion was short-lived, though, as the Swiss Guards put it down brutally. Perugia remains firmly under pontifical rule, and it will be a while before the Italian unionists stage an invasion of the Papal States.
The Pope doesn't answer to the people. He answers to God.

The First Ecumenical Council of the Vatican was the twentieth Ecumenical Council of the Catholic Church and the first to occur since the Council of Trent over four hundred years ago. Spanning two years of theological debate and doctrinal planning, 744 Catholic bishops from across the globe convened in Rome to define the Church's doctrine, in response to the massive emergence of new ideologies such as liberalism, Marxism, and rationalism. The Vatican I Council would in the end ratify two constitutional documents: the incipit "Dei Filius", and "Pastor aeternus," which defined both the primacy of St. Peter among the Apostles of Christ and the doctrines of papal supremacy and papal infallibility. The latter would ultimately result in significant backlash against Catholicism as a political presence in secular states across Europe. It would ignite the Prusso-German "Kulturkampf" and result in both France and Austria annulling their historic concordats with the Papal Curia.
The Church believes and confesses that there is one, true, living God.
The Portuguese Reconquest of Inhambane and Lourenço Marques

The Organ of British Jewry, incorporating the Jewish world.\n\nOn this day, the Jewish Chronicle, the world's first English-language newspaper focusing on Jewish affairs, was launched. The periodical is edited under the guises of D. Meldola and M. Angel, focusing on the affairs of Anglo-Jews and serving to uphold their dignity in the media. Britain is home to thousands of Sephardic and Ashkenazi Jews, with hopes high among them for political emancipation. Notable signs of reforms granting British Jews political freedoms have emerged in recent years: for example, financier Moses Haim Montefiore was knighted in 1830, and Isaac Lyon Goldsmid became the first Jewish baronet in England four years later. Jews still face barriers, however--most notably the fact that only a Christian may serve in the British government.

We have received a commission for a railway to connect the cities of Ruse, Pliska, and Varna from an British company, who in turn were rewarded a land grant from our government to build such a line. The benefit to the local population and economy will be great.

On the 97th anniversary of our grand victory against Spanish royalists at Chacabuco, we have commemorated the day by inaugurating a monument in Mendoza province. The monument, titled "Cerro de la Gloria," shows troops from the Army of the Andes around the bottom of a rock hill, while at the rock's top sits more troops and an angel breaking a chain in two. On the monument's front is inscribed "La Patria al Ejército de los Andes"--from the fatherland to the Andean Army.

The District of Berar was ceded to the Nizam of Hyderabad in perpetuity in the partition treaty of 1804. These lands formerly held by the Maratha Sindhia dynasty have fallen prey to the turbulent elements let loose by the sudden cessation of the wars. From time to time bands of soldiers, that we are powerless to control, scour the country, pillaging villages and terrorizing the countryside. It has been suggested that we cede this troubled district to the East India Company so that they may maintain order where we cannot. It would still officially remain a dominion of the Nizam's but be maintained entirely by the British.

With recent diamond and gold rushes taking place in Kimberley, Witwatersrand and other areas located south of Lobengula's Kingdom of Matabeleland, many suspect that there may be huge untapped resources to be exploited in his lands. Thus, it has been proposed that we conduct a treaty that gives us exclusive mining rights in his domains. We might even be able to deceitfully sneak in a couple clauses unbeknownst to the natives, a common trick when dealing with Africans who can't read English-language treaties. This could eventually give us justification for annexing Matabeleland.

Charles Dunell Rudd, a business associate of the famed diamond mining magnate Cecil Rhodes, has arrived in Bulawayo with a proposal for a treaty between the British South Africa Company and our kingdom. We can't read the treaty ourselves since it is in English, but Rudd tells us that the terms are as follows: We indefinitely sign away mining rights in our lands to the Company. In return, it provides us with 1,000 Martini-Henry breech-loading rifles, 100,000 rounds of ammunition and a large lump sum of British pounds followed by a perpetual monthy payment. This could help strengthen our army and be key in defending ourselves from attacks by our neighbors.

King Lobengula of Matabeleland has, after conferring with his council, signed the treaty brought to him by Charles D. Rudd. Unbeknownst to Lobengula, Rudd fooled him by making false promises not actually included in the treaty, such as that no more than ten miners would be allowed to enter Matabeleland and that they would follow his laws. He has effectively allowed us to occupy his land. The right honorable diamond mining magnate Cecil Rhodes has described the concession as so gigantic it is like giving a man the whole of Australia. Another victory for the British Empire!

It seems that we have been hoodwinked by the British. Charles D. Rudd assured us that no more than 10 Brits would enter our lands and that they would follow our laws. This was in fact not spelled out in the English-language treaty that we couldn't read. Instead, the British have now sent masses of miners and settlers into our lands. They have come not only to dig the gold but to rob us of our people and country as well.

Charles D. Rudd has been turned away from King Lobengula's court in Bulawayo. His council advised him against it as they were suspicious of conducting treaties with white men whom they view as generally treacherous and deceitful. This leaves Matabeleland in danger of being snatched up by the Portuguese, the Boers, or even other colonizers from the North. It may be wise to take armed action to ensure it does not fall into the hands of our adversaries.

Troubling news has reached us from Rhodesia. King Lobengula, who has thus far wisely avoided conflict with us, has, despite his previous promises not to, undertaken a raid against a Shona chief in our settled territories in the North. The chief had formerly been Lobengula's vassal but had declared his allegiance instead to Britain and its laws directly. Lobengula could not let this stand lest his other subservient chiefs do the same and sent out a raiding party to punish the offender. At the sight of a raiding party destroying a friendly chiefdom in our settled lands, the South Africa Company administration dispatched troops to force the attackers into retreat, causing a skirmish with dead and wounded on both sides. This blatant attack on our soil is cause for war.

A calamitous mistake has lead us to war with Britain. Chief Gomara, who had previously been our vassal, declared his allegiance instead to the United Kingdom. Naturally, we could not let this stand and sent a raiding party to teach him a lesson lest other chiefs attempt the same. However, British troops arrived and began a skirmish with our forces, causing us to retreat, but not before inflicting casualties on them. This unintended confrontation has now lead to an all-out war for our survival.

Following a skirmish with a raiding party, Britain has relinquished their hold over us. A diplomat has informed us that the United Kingdom no longer views Matabeleland as their protectorate and that the Rudd Concession was fraudulent. The British must have been intimidated by the prospect of all-out war with our forces and opted to avoid it by whatever means necessary.

Matabeleland has risen up in revolt. Mlimo, the Ndebele religious leader, is responsible. By blaming our benevolent colonial administration for every ill befalling the natives from cattle disease to crop failure, he has angered the tribesmen so severely that they have attacked several of our settlements. Swift action is necessary if we are to relieve the sieges before our settlers are massacred.

After we invaded the Rozvi Empire on our way northward after having been defeated by the Boer Trekkers, we achieved dominance over the region. However, Tohwechipi, the son of Rozvi Emperor Chirisamhuru escaped to the Buhera area and built up his influence in the last decades. We have asked him to swear fealty but were met with rejection. We must bring the last remainder of the Rozvi Empire under our control if we are to secure our position. \n\n§RWarning: You have to merge the brigades that are generated by this event§W

The Matabele have launched an invasion of our remaining lands. Our continued resistance to their aggressive influence has lead to a gradual increase in conflict resulting in this escalation. If we manage to defeat them now, we will gloriously retake our former Empire. But if we are defeated, it will spell the end for our Empire.

Captain Henry Douglas Warden, British Resident among the tribes living beyond the Frontier to the North-East, has proposed proclaiming sovereignty over the region of Transorangia, or the land North of the Orange river. The Orange River Sovereignty would allow us to create a new northward buffer towards the Boers and the Sotho, give us new opportunities to exploit possible resources and allow us to expand further.

The British Resident among the tribes living beyond the Frontier to the North-East, Captain Douglas Warden, has proclaimed the Orange River Sovereignty. This British territory spans the land between the Orange and Vaal Rivers. We could attempt to resist the Anglos, but their forces are numerically, strategically and technologically superior. It would be wise to simply accept the lost territory rather than being annexed entirely.

Scottish missionary John Mackenzie, a Congregationalist of the London Missionary Society, has petitioned our government to send a military expedition into Bechuanaland to establish a protectorate there. He believes that swift action is necessary to prevent peoples like the Bamangwato from being threatened by Boer freebooters encroaching on their territory from the South. Businessmen have also shown interest in the endeavor, as there may be goldfields in Bechuanaland similar to those found nearby.
Fully fund reconstruction efforts. §R(Pay or owe 35,000¤)§W
Send the minimum amount to help. §R(Pay or owe 20,000¤)§W
We can't afford anything right now.

The quiet town of St. John's in Labrador and Newfoundland is reeling from the worst natural disaster it has ever faced. At mid-afternoon today, a fire from a local stable spread across the entire town, destroying the majority of it. Its spread was exacerbated by wind currents that blew it into sections across the town--it would otherwise have stayed in a small area of it. Refugees then took refuge in the stone walls of the Cathedral of John the Baptist, in the nave and transepts of which they stored their valuables. Alas, despite these townsfolk's belief that the stone would block the flames, the cathedral was destroyed as well as much of the inhabitants' property.

I pledge allegiance to my flag and the republic for which it stands, one nation, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all.\n\n Today, socialist Christian minister Francis Bellamy published a model oath of allegiance to the United States in children's magazine The Youth's Companion, of which he is the circulation manager. He writes this pledge out of a deep love for social equality, which he ties to the foundational principles of his country. He aspires for future generations to carry on that love, so that he, in his words, will not have died in vain.

The American public is left outraged by the execution of Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti, two Italian-born anarchists accused of robbery and murder in Braintree, Massachusetts. A highly contentious trial in which conflicting evidence cast extreme doubt on their guilt, the two were sentenced to death by the electric chair. The trial became complicated by a set of appeals made by a defense committee made on their behalf, though it was all in vain.\n\nOutrage ensued, with the court being accused of being prejudiced against Italians, who have become one of the largest immigrants groups in recent times, and anarchists. Furthermore, leftists the world over are protesting the execution, including in every major North American and European city.

A bill known as the Antiquities Act has entered Congress. If it were to pass and become a law, it would set aside federal land to create national monuments. This act bases the creation of national monuments on the belief that these lands are "objects of historic and scientific interest." In a time of rapid industrialization and urban growth, our government finds it imperative to stop our most valuable cultural assets from being lost. Call it a blow to capitalism, a step forward for humanity--or both.

The Kingdom of Swaziland under Mswati II has been increasingly endangered from all sides. Located between Portuguese Mozambique, the Zulu, our Boer Republic and the British, the Swazi seem destined to be conquered. However, King Mswati II has signalled his willingness to negotiate to diplomatically preserve his domain, as he would inevitably lose on the battlefield. We already conducted a minor border treaty in 1846, which -- though it only roughly delimited our border and Swaziland only ceded us land it had no control over anyway -- shows a willingness to give up land rather than face an invasion. Perhaps the time has come to once again pressure the Swazi into giving up land to our benefit.

Diplomats from $FROMCOUNTRY$ bearing a proposed treaty have arrived in $CAPITAL$. In essence, it would cede a large portion of our land in exchange for 160 heads of cattle. The deal is obviously deeply unfair, as the land we and our ancestors have inhabited for generations is infinitely more valuable than a measly pile of meat that wouldn't even feed our nation for a day. However, the Boers are likely to take the land by force if we refuse to sign the treaty. With their western weapons and larger army, we would likely lose many men in addition to the land. Perhaps surrendering it now would be for the better.
King Mswati II has begrudgingly signed the treaty we proposed to him. Our forces have moved into the ceded lands and the agreed 160 heads of cattle have been delivered in exchange.

King Mswati II has angrily refused to sign the treaty we proposed to him. Swaziland has begun preparing for war, as they view the deal as deeply unjust and aggressive. Shall we teach them a lesson and take the land for ourselves?

War has broken out with the Bapedi Kingdom led by Sekhukhune I. They have long been a thorn in our side, taking refuge in the mountains of the East and ambushing our forces only to disperse into the wilderness once more. Despite the Bapedi having been infuriatingly successful at defeating our troops, we are forced to commit more men to the area, because not doing so would mean admitting defeat to a bunch of tribesmen and great humiliation.

The Tswana people have been living in separate tribes as long as we can remember. Batawana, Bamangwato, Bakwena and Bangwaketse, just to name a few. Now that we have militarily ensured our unity, the time has come to integrate one another in perpetuity and proclaim a new Tswana Empire.
Explain that you could give territory to the Bapedi while still being under your control, as a sort of autonomy

With recent instability in our kingdom, Portugal has seized the opportunity and invaded our coastal lands. Portuguese influence has been slowly creeping into our domains for a while now. Their stronger presence would surely be much more difficult to rid ourselves of than fifteen years ago, especially considering our current instability. Perhaps it is for the best if we accept our territorial losses and lick our wounds.

A raiding party of around a thousand Boers has crossed into our lands from the Southeast. Their justification for this aggression is that the chief of the Bakgatla-ba-ga mmanana has supposedly committed several murders in Boer lands and that they have arrived to capture and punish him. After other Tswana tribes joined us to fight the outside attacker in unison, a pitched battle took place, leading to an initial Boer victory followed by a successful counterattack using captured rifles of fallen Boers. Both sides have sustained large casualties.

A battle has taken place between our forces and a horde of Tswana tribesmen. An expedition had been sent into the Bamangwato lands to punish the chief of the Bakgatla-ba-ga mmanana who has committed several murders in Boer lands and subsequently fled Northwest. Surprisingly, Tswana tribes banded together to defend him, eventually overwhelming our forces in the heat of battle, forcing us into a humiliating retreat. While we have certainly taught the Tswana a lesson they won't soon forget, inflicting many casualties on them, it is certainly shameful to have to retreat.

As of now, our country lacks a writing system. This slows our development and communication considerably. Thankfully, an opportunity has presented itself: Several missionaries from the Paris Evangelical Missionary Society have arrived in our lands. We could turn them away and prevent them from converting any of our people to their strange religion. Alternatively, if we let them stay, they have informed us that they intend to translate a book that they call the "Bible" into Sesotho, thus giving us a basis to adopt a writing system with.

The Trekkers of Winburg, though they initially defeated the local natives, have now bitten off more than they can chew. The enraged tribesmen have swarmed into the new republic's lands and pose an existential threat to its survival. If we do not send aid to the Boers, they may be entirely wiped out.

The Boer settlers of the Potchefstroom Republic have encountered significant resistance in the lands they have attempted to settle on the right side of the Vaal River. The natives, expected to be easily defeated and driven off, have proven to be much more formidable, posing a significant threat to the Trekkers. They may even be wiped out by the determined tribesmen if we do not intervene on their behalf. It must, however, be taken into account that sending support so far to the Northeast would be logistically difficult and expensive, especially considering we don't stand to gain much of anything by providing it.

The local rulers of the lands that we proclaimed to be a part of the Orange River Sovereignty have adamantly and vehemently refused to accept its legitimacy. We must now decide whether it is worth losing men to enforce our proclamation or whether we should simply accept their refusal and move on.

The Second Zulu Civil War is at its end. Caused by a succession crisis following the death of king Mpande between his two eldest sons, Cetshwayo and Mbuyazi. In the climactic final confrontation, Mbuyazi's followers were massacred and he himself was killed. Now, stability has finally returned to our kingdom -- for better or worse.

Since the border treaty of 1855, we have been steadily increasing our influence over Swaziland. We were even able to establish the levying of customs on the Maputo River within Swazi territory. Now, the culmination of these efforts has been reached. President Andries Pretorius has proclaimed in the Staatscourant newspaper that Swaziland is now annexed. However, no actual steps have been taken to establish sovereignty over it. Portugal, Britain and of course the Swazi themselves have expressed great concern over our unilateral proclamation. Maybe it would be for the best to leave it at that.
Andries Pretorius, President of the Transvaal has proclaimed the annexation of our country and sent an invasion force. We must now fight for our survival.
Has clicked the "Return to our Homeland" decision
Has clicked the "Formally annex our Tributaries" decision

The invasion of the destructive and merciless Trekkers from the South forced us to flee northward to the lands of the Rozvi Empire. However, our true homeland remained in the South. After licking our wounds and building up a strong army once more, the time came to drive out the Boers once and for all. However, our true homeland is indeed not the land North of the Vaal River. Our great leader, Mzilikazi, a former Zulu lieutenant, originally crossed the Drakensberg Range northward after his relationship with Shaka Zulu soured. Returning to our homeland forevermore therefore means retaking the Zulu heartlands to our South and uniting as one.

§RGain 3 infamy§! When Mzilikazi fled northward, he first crossed through the lands of the Gaza Empire. There, he and his forces were brutally attacked by Emperor Soshangane's army, forcing them to flee West. With our homeland secured, the time has come to punish the perfidious Soshangane and take his domains for ourselves.

The tribes in the Northwest of our great empire have long been informal tributaries. Centered around the settlements of Moyo and Massekisse, these decentralized and disorganized tribes need to be integrated into our domains. Otherwise, we are unable to control them and the region may be vulnerable to outside attack.

With the North under our control and the Portuguese all but crushed, the time has come to expand West. The Boers and the Zulu have given us much trouble time and time again. To ensure our security and grow our power, we therefore simply must conquer our western borderlands.

In our late iron age, we constructed a great city by the name of Great Zimbabwe that still partially stands today. It housed the royal palace of a great kingdom, and is thus the ancestral capital of us Shona. By returning to our legendary roots, we may return to our former glory -- or even surpass it.

Argentina's government has come once again to a head. Only 3 years after the Revolution of the Park, members of the Unión Cívica have attempted to overthrow dictatorial rule from the Partido Autónomo Nacional (PAN) through violence. However, Unión Cívica leader Bartolome Mitre soon sought cooperation with with PAN, creating a rift leading to fellow Unión leader Leandro Alem to form the Unión Cívica Radical (UCR). These militants are seizing power in Buenos Aires, Santa Fe, Tucumán, and Corrientes, demanding an end to fraudulent elections repeatedly won by PAN. They hope for a truly free democracy.

The Unión Cívica Radical is trying yet again to seize power and demand free elections. They have fomented an uprising under Hipólito Yrigoyen's leadership, taking siege in Buenos Aires, Campo de Mayo, Bahía Blanca, Mendoza, Córdoba and Santa Fé. The militants have taken vice president José Figueroa Alcorta hostage and have attempted to do the same to former president Julio Argentino Roca.

Thanks to out intervention in the protracted conflict with the Zulu, Natalia has emerged victorious. Now, all that remains to be settled is whether we recognize the Trekkers as having founded a new independent nation of their own -- or if we maintain that they are simply colonists still under the British crown.

The local rulers of the lands that we proclaimed to be a part of the Orange River Sovereignty have begrudgingly accepted its legitimacy. New border agreements have been made with them and the Warden Line has been secured.

Our fellow Boers have manage to create their own independent nation free from both the British and the natives in the savanna north of the Vaal River, we should come together with our brethren to form a stronger union.

Thanks to out intervention in the protracted conflict with the Basotho, Winburg has emerged victorious. The Sotho have been taught a lesson they won't soon forget and our influence in the Northeast is secured.

Thanks to out intervention in the protracted conflict with the Mthwakazi, Potchefstroom has emerged victorious. The Ndebele have been taught a lesson they won't soon forget and our influence in the Northeast is secured.

Albanian nationalist Naum Veqilharxhi has proposed adopting a new writing system for the Albanian language. This script, called the Vikhtuqi script, is named after Veqilharxhi's home village and bases itself on the Latin alphabet, with some unique characteristics. The script has been typefaced and copied by lithographing Veqilharxhi's books. Though publishing works through a printing press in a new typeface is expensive, perhaps the Albanian language could use its own script to awaken the strive for independence.

For centuries, millennia even, our people have had an intimate and inseparable relation with Lazica and its surrounding lands, even if the Kartvelians in the north pathetically attempt to prove otherwise. Now that us, the great Laz people, have strengthened their position in the Caucasus, we are now able to liberate Lazica from the clutches of the Kartvelians, and free our Laz brethren.

News has arrived from the Illustrierte Zeitung of Leipzig that a new sports association calling itself Dresden Football Club (DFC) has been founded. The sport in question, "football", involves the ball being propelled forward by the players' feet! Two teams compete against one another, with members of each team wearing differently colored costumes to be easily differentiated. These consist of a kind of woolen or silk shirt with or without sleeves, tight-fitting leg coverings that show the bare knee, long stockings and very comfortable shoes or lace-up boots.

The Zeppelin LZ 1 is the first successful experimental rigid airship. It was first flown today from a floating hangar on Lake Constance, near Friedrichshafen in southern Germany. "LZ" stands for Luftschiff Zeppelin, or "Airship Zeppelin". Count Zeppelin had been devoting his energies to the design of large rigid-framed airships since his retirement from the army in 1890. In 1898 he established the Gesellschaft zur Förderung der Luftschifffahrt. The company had a subscribed capital of 800,000 Deutschmarks, of which Zeppelin contributed 300,000 Deutschmarks: the remainder was provided by various industrialists, including 100,000 Deutschmarks contributed by Carl Berg, whose company provided the aluminium framework of the airship.

Tragedy. The Bazar de la Charité, the annual charity event held in Paris, burned down after one of the pieces of cinematograph equipment malfunctioned and caught fire. The warehouse was made almost entirely out of wood and filled with cardboard, clothes and other flammable materials. It also contained over 300 attendees inside at the time. The state of the victims' remains has made dental records necessary for identification. Among the 126 of the victims was Sophie Charlotte Augustine, the late Duchess of Alençon.

Two months ago, relations between the two largest parties in Spain--the Progressive Party, leaning liberal, and the Moderate party, leaning conservative--broke after Evaristo's plan to reform the function of town councils, reducing their autonomy and making them all appointed from Madrid, caused a huge political divide. The Progressives automatically rejected the plan, saying it was against the 1837 Constitution.
